children.name: efficient
children.definition: an efficient organization, method, or system is one in which all the parts work well together and good results are achieved without any money or time being wasted:
examples: The passport office seems very efficient - I got a new passport in just 48 hours.
We need more efficient methods of transporting goods
efficiently[adverb] B2
Under the new management, the business is working much more efficiently.

children.name: extremely/highly efficient
examples: The factory is modern and highly efficient.

children.name: an efficient way
examples: Email is an efficient way of contacting a large number of people.

children.name: an efficient method
examples: The railways used to provide a cheap efficient method of travel.

children.name: an efficient means
examples: The tram is a very efficient means of transport.

children.name: an efficient system
examples: We need a more efficient system for collecting money.

children.name: an efficient service
examples: We aim to provide our clients with an efficient and friendly service.

children.name: the efficient use of something
examples: We must work towards the more efficient use of all natural resources.

children.name: the efficient operation of something
examples: The law must protect investors without interfering with the efficient operation of the market.

children.name: energy/fuel efficient
children.definition: not wasting any fuel or energy
examples: an energy efficient heating system

children.name: cost efficient
children.definition: costing or spending as little as possible
examples: The larger a firm becomes the more cost efficient it can become.

children.name: well-organized U
children.definition: well-organized also well-organisedBritish /ˌwel ˈɔːʳgənaɪzd◂/  organized in a careful and efficient way, and therefore likely to be successful:

children.name: Được tổ chức tốt
examples: ▪ The exhibition was very well-organized.
Buổi triển lãm đã được tổ chức rất tốt.
▪ It was a well-organized demonstration, in which about 1000 people took part.
Đó là một cuộc biểu tình có tổ chức, trong đó có khoảng 1000 người tham gia.
▪ More employers now have well-financed and well-organized health promotion programs within the workplace.
Nhiều nhà tuyển dụng ngày nay có các chương trình nâng cao sức khỏe được tài trợ và tổ chức tốt ngay trong môi trường làm việc.

children.name: well-run U
children.definition: well-run/ˌwel ˈrʌn◂/  use this about an organization or business that is successful and efficient because the people in charge organize it well:

children.name: Được điều hành tốt/ Hoạt động tốt
examples: ▪ The Klausner is a comfortable, well-run hotel.
Klausner là một khách sạn tiện nghi và được điều hành tốt.
▪ Public transport in this country is well-run and inexpensive.
Giao thông công cộng ở nước này hoạt động tốt và không tốn kém.

children.name: well-oiled
children.definition: machine an organization or system that is very efficient and operates easily, without any problems:

children.name: run/work like a well-oiled machine
examples: ▪ The administration runs like a well-oiled machine.

children.name: smooth
children.definition: /smuːð/  efficient and without problems or difficulties: suôn sẻ, trôi chảy
examples: ▪ To ensure a smooth change-over, we’d like you to start work one week before your predecessor leaves.
▪ FrontPage is a software program that helps to organize the entire web site so that it works in a smooth fashion.
▪ The main responsibility of the Project Co-ordinator is to ensure the smooth running of the department.

children.name: efficient
children.definition: use this about a machine that works well and produces good results without any money or time being wasted:
examples: ▪ This is the most efficient and economical washing machine on the market.
▪ My new computer’s much faster and more efficient than the old one was.
energy efficientusing less gas, oil etc than other systems, machines etc
▪ Modern houses are much more energy efficient
▪ an energy efficient heating system
efficiently[adv] B2
work/run efficiently
▪The shower doesn’t seem to be working very efficiently at the moment.

children.name: economical
children.definition: a machine or vehicle that is economical is not expensive to use or run because it does not use much electricity, oil, gas etc:
examples: ▪ People should be encouraged to buy smaller, more economical cars with fewer toxic emissions.
▪ The Unipot does the work of several saucepans, and is very economical.

children.name: economical on
examples: ▪ I’d like to buy a car that is more economical on petrol.

children.name: efficient
children.definition: sb who is efficient works well and does what needs to be done without wasting time: có năng lực
examples: For a successful business, friendly and efficient staff are essential.
The doctor was cheerful and efficient, which immediately made me feel more relaxed.

children.name: effective
children.definition: sb who is effective, especially sb in a position of authority, deals quickly and successfully with the work they have to do: hiệu quả, được việc
examples: An effective teacher will always produce better exam results.
What we need is a tough and effective leader with a sense of direction .

children.name: capable
children.definition: sb who is capable does things well and confidently and does not need anyone else’s help or advice: có khả năng, năng lực
examples: ▪ All the staff at the nursing home seemed very capable.
▪ They’ve got a very capable lawyer working on the case.
▪ Rebecca was, without question, the most capable technician on the team.

children.name: well-organized U
children.definition: well-organized/well-organisedUK  sb who is well-organized plans things well so that they achieve what they want to achieve:có đầu óc tổ chức/ sắp xếp
examples: If you work as a personal assistant, you need to be well-organized.Well-organized rebel forces have succeeded in recapturing the town.

children.name: businesslike
children.definition: sb who is businesslike deals with people effectively and does not waste time on things that are not important:
examples: ▪ As a lawyer, you have to be controlled and businesslike at all times.
▪ Gates gave a brief, businesslike explanation of his plans for the company.

children.name: run a tight ship
children.definition: /rʌn ə ˌtaɪt ˈʃɪp/  to manage a business or company very efficiently, especially by having strict rules and by not allowing the people working there to have much freedom:

children.name: Điều hành công việc rất chặt chẽ, nghiêm ngặt
examples: ▪ We run a very tight ship here, and we expect all our employees to be at their desks by nine o'clock.
Chúng tôi điều hành công việc rất chặt chẽ, và chúng tôi mong đợi tất cả nhân viên đều ở bàn làm việc trước 9 giờ.

children.name: productive
children.definition: sb who is productive does a job efficiently and with good results, because they work faster than most people or do more work than most people:có năng suất
examples: Studies show that if screen workers have short but frequent breaks they become much more productive.
The most productive members of staff are rewarded by financial bonuses.

children.name: to make a business or system more efficient
increase efficiency
children.definition: improve//ɪmˌpruːv, ɪnˌkriːs ɪˈfɪʃənsi/
examples: ▪ We must increase efficiency and reduce costs if we are to make a profit this year
.▪ The company has concentrated on encouraging worker involvement and improving efficiency
.▪ Less complex business processes can reduce costs and improve efficiency and quality.

children.name: streamline
children.definition: to make the processes of a business or system simpler so that it operates more quickly and more efficiently:
examples: We have streamlined the whole business by introducing a new computer system.

children.name: People are calling for steps to reform the juvenile justice system, including streamlining the process of prosecuting young offenders
rationalize
children.definition: /rationaliseUK  to make a business or system more efficient by making it quicker, more modern, and less wasteful: hợp lý hóa
examples: Since the administrative side of the business has been rationalized, all departments have become more efficient.
The budget proposed selling off $1,300 million worth of state-run enterprises and rationalizing the tax structure.

children.name: inefficient
children.definition: sb/sth that is inefficient does not work as well as they should or could, in a way that wastes time, money, or effort:kém hiệu quả
examples: The postal service in this country is very inefficient.
Inefficient management leads to poor employee performance.
inefficiency[U]
Because of our lawyer’s inefficiency, we had to wait another month before moving into our new house.
problems due to the inefficiency of management

children.name: an inefficient use of resources
examples: Local government was inefficient.

children.name: ineffectual
children.definition: a person or organization that is ineffectual is not able to get things done because they are not good enough or do not have a strong character:bất lực, yếu kém
examples: The police were completely ineffectual in this matter.
He’s a nice enough man, but rather ineffectual as a team captain.The problems were made worse by the ineffectual political leadership of the coalition.

children.name: ineffective
children.definition: sb who is ineffective, especially sb in a position of authority, is not able to deal successfully with the work they have to do: không làm ăn được gì, vô tích sự
examples: I sometimes feel that she is just totally ineffective in this job.
A combination of ineffective management and inadequate investment brought about this collapse.

children.name: efficiency
children.definition: the quality of doing sth well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy
examples: efficiency of
the efficiency of the train service
considerable advancements inenergy efficiency

children.name: improve/increase efficiency
examples: The company is taking steps to improve efficiency and reduce costs.|Recent efforts by American business to increase efficiency seem to have failed.

children.name: promote efficiency
children.definition: develop or encourage efficient ways of doing something
examples: A competitive market helps to promote efficiency.

children.name: greater/increased efficiency
examples: In a search for greater efficiency, the two departments have merged.

children.name: maximum efficiency
children.definition: the most that is possible
examples: The boat's design helps it to move with maximum efficiency.

children.name: fuel efficiency
children.definition: using fuel in an efficient way
examples: Better fuel efficiency can be achieved by driving more slowly.

children.name: energy efficiency
children.definition: using energy in an efficient way
examples: Energy efficiency can play a huge role in reducing pollution.

children.name: high efficiency
children.definition: used about machines
examples: The diesel engine offers high efficiency and low fuel consumption.

children.name: operating/operational efficiency
children.definition: the efficiency with which a machine or system works
examples: The computer can process this information quickly, without any loss of operating efficiency.

children.name: efficiency gains
children.definition: increases in efficiency
examples: New technology introduced by the company has brought efficiency gains.

children.name: efficiency savings
children.definition: money saved by being more efficient
examples: Efficiency savings in the industry will inevitably lead to job losses.

children.name: efficiency measures
children.definition: changes introduced to make something more efficient
examples: The new efficiency measures are designed to improve the health service.

children.name: standards of efficiency
examples: Their work led to higher standards of efficiency across the industry.

children.name: technical
children.definition: adjective

children.name: relating to practical skills and methods that are used in a particular activity
examples: _In her performance as the Snow Queen she showed great technical brilliance.

children.name: working
children.definition: adjectiveUSEFUL

children.name: describes a plan, idea or knowledge that is not complete but is good enough to be useful
examples: _We have a workingtheory/hypothesisabout what caused the crash, which we shall test.
_She's fluent in French and English and has a workingknowledgeof Spanish.
